revision.comment: /* How do I add an action to a the popup menu of the Java editor? */ Fixed wrong path in example
revision.text:
__NOTOC__ ===How do I add an action to a the popup menu of the Java editor?=== The simplest way is to run New Action Wizard (File > New... > Module Development > Action) which creates an action for you and registers it in your layer.xml. # On the first tab, choose '''Conditionally Enabled''' action and select EditorCookie as the cookie class. # On the second tab, check '''Editor Context Menu Item''' and choose MIME type (text/x-java in this case) and position. OR use 
@ActionReference(path="Editors/text/x-java/Popup")
for an action with the EditorCookie as context object
===See also:=== * [[DevFaqActionAddToContextMenuOfAllEditors|How do I add an action to the context menu of all editors?]] * [[DevFaqActionAddFileMime| How do I add an action to a file of a given mime-type? ]] * [[DevFaqActionAddFolder| How do I add an action to a folder? ]] * [[DevFaqActionAddEditorPopup| How do I add an action to the text-editor popup menu? ]] * [[DevFaqActionAddMenuBar| How do I add an action to the NetBeans menu bar? ]] * [[DevFaqActionAddToolBar| How do I add an action to the NetBeans tool bar? ]] * [[DevFaqActionAddDataObject| How do I add an action to my custom node? ]]
